definition: snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: The snow line here has risen 150 meters, and glaciers have retreated by 10 kilometers.
sentences.chinese: 雪線升高了150米，冰川也因此消退了10千米。

sentences.english: Alpine plants distribute mainly in regions between tree lines and snow lines and are regarded as some of the most sensitive plants to environmental changes.
sentences.chinese: 高山植物是一類生長於樹線以上至雪線的山地植物。

sentences.english: Some plants can even survive in favorable microhabitats above the snow line.
sentences.chinese: 在雪線以上，一些植物甚至能在有利的小環境中生存。

sentences.english: Often stretched to the mysterious mist, below the snowline increased the illusion.
sentences.chinese: 常伸展到雪線以下飄渺的雲霧，增加了這種幻覺。

sentences.english: Many of La Paz's residents swear the snow-line is gradually creeping upwards.
sentences.chinese: 許多拉巴斯市的居民發誓雪線在逐漸爬升。

sentences.english: From the old ice stage to new one, the snowline rose higher and higher.
sentences.chinese: 從新到老，每次冰期的雪線下降幅度一次比一次大。

sentences.english: In north China, there are lots of lovely animals living above the snow line.
sentences.chinese: 在北國的雪線上有很多可愛的小動物。

sentences.english: In substance, the changes of setup of climatic snowline in space are a reflection of variations of the hydrothermal condition.
sentences.chinese: 雪線空間格局變化實質上是水熱條件變化的反映。

sentences.english: Some in the north finding their way to Erie, Niagara, Ottawa.
sentences.chinese: 北國的雪線就在那伊利湖，尼亞加拉，渥太華。

sentences.english: But in the past few years, the snow-line has risen 500m.
sentences.chinese: 但過去幾年，雪線上升了500米。

sentences.english: At low latitudes, the atmosphere is warm and the snowline is high.
sentences.chinese: 在低緯度地區，大氣溫暖，雪線較高。

pinyin: Xi3 ma3 la1 ya3 shan1 mai4

definition: lit. plaintive whine of geese (idiom); fig. land swarming with disaster victims/starving people fill the land
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
lit. dragons and snakes mingle (idiom)/fig. a mix of good people and scumbags
